free: #e A child was at home with his dog.
#c 一個孩子跟他的狗一起在家。
#e There was frog inside a bottle .
#c 有青蛙在瓶子裡面。
#e They had fun with the frog.
#c 他們玩那個青蛙。
#e They watched each other.
#c 他們一直互相對看。
#e Then the child fell asleep.
#c 然後，那個孩子睡著了。
#e The frog jumped out from the bottle.
#c 那個青蛙從瓶子裡跳出來了。
#n mataidaza: leap or jump
#e Then he was shocked to find out why the frog was not inside the bottle anymore.
#c 然後孩子很驚訝看到為什麼青蛙沒有在瓶子裡面了。
#n iatu < viatu
#e Then he got up (from the bed).
#c 然後那個孩子起床了。
#e He saw the shoe, wondering whether it hid still inside. No.
#c 他看那個鞋子，看青蛙是否躲在裡面。沒有。
#n au < adu
#n -luhi 指幼獸，只有狗能用。
#e Then the puppy put its head into the bottle,smelling to find out where the frog was going.
#c 小狗把自己的頭放進瓶子裡，到那邊去聞青蛙到底往哪裡去。
#e They looked for it but find nothing. Then they were yelling all along over there.
#c 他們尋找，但是沒有。然後他們在那邊一直叫喊。

gloss: 今天=改變狀態=近距.斜格

free: #e Later the dog fell out from window to the ground.
#c 那個狗狗從窗戶摔下來到外面地上。
#n una’us < una’u-un mas
#e #e Then the child embraced the dog, checking if it felt hurt, if it was okay or injured because of the bottle’s being broken out.
#c 然後，因為瓶子是摔破的，那個孩子抱它，看它是否很痛，是否受傷。
#e Then they went out to the so-called corridor.
#c 然後他們就走出去外面到所謂的走廊。
#n tangnata: 房子前面的走廊
#n tan = tang; tan’ulung=房子的後面; tan’iku=背後
#e Then they went over there, keeping yelling: “Hey frog, where did you go?”
#c 然後他們去一直叫青蛙說: 你去哪裡了？
#n usa=bi=s < usa=bin=mas
#n usa = isa
#e Before long, they kept yelling noisily there.
#c 不久之後，他們就在那裡一直吵著叫喊。
#n nii tu zaav 不久
#e They found a hole.
#c 他們找到一個洞。
#e The kid went there to see the hole and to blow at that hole.
#c 那個孩子去那個洞那邊觀察吹氣。
#e He blew to check whether the frog was in there, without knowing what came out was a mouse living inside.
#c 他吹氣，看是不是青蛙在裡面，不知道出來的就是在裡面的老鼠。
#e We call it mouse.
#c 我們叫那個老鼠。
#n malkauni: 專注地做
#e The dog then stared at the hornets’ nest.
#c 他看見在樹上所謂的虎頭蜂窩。
#e It was there keeping barking and trying to prank it.
#c 它在那邊一直叫想要搗蛋。
#n 這裡的 asu=a 講錯了
#e The dog shook (the tree), and the hornets’ nest dropped.
#c 狗把（樹）搖動，虎頭蜂窩掉下來。
#e The mouse also showed up.
#c 那個老鼠也跑出來。
#e Then the kid climbed up the tree and shed the hornets’ nest.
#c 然後那個孩子爬上樹去了，弄掉那個虎頭蜂窩。
#n ma-hal-hal-ik uvaz cia: 我把那個孩子丟下來
#e They we’re playing there.
#c 他們在那裡遊戲。
#e The kid shocked. He was shocked and fell down because the eagle showed up all of a sudden.
#c 孩子嚇了一跳，因為在樹上老鷹突然跑出來，所以他嚇了一跳就掉下來。
#e The dog was cased by the hornets, and the kid also ran away to hide.
#c 那個虎頭蜂追那個狗，然後孩子也跑去躲起來了。
#e The eagle flied after him and tried to peck and bite him.
#c 因為要被老鷹追著啄咬他的頭。
#e Then they went onto the stone, and the dog hid behind.
#c 他們爬到石頭上面，狗也躲在下面。
#n nadau < nadadu
#e He was chased by the hornets; maybe he was bitten. He felt so depressed there.
#c 他一直被虎頭蜂追，可能有被咬過很痛，他在那裡很無奈。
#e He hid behind the stone and the wood, not knowing the dog was still running over.
#c 他們就躲在石頭, 在木頭，不知道那個狗還在跑來跑去。
#e A buffalo or a deer was running after it.
#c 原來有一隻牛，叫做山鹿在追他。
#e The deer rans away too. Because running away, it didn’t know the kid and the dog was dropped and fell.
#c 那個鹿也跑掉，因為也要逃跑，不知道那個孩子和狗狗跟著它(鹿)掉下來, 跌倒。
#e The dog and the kid dropped into the water at the same time, and the deer was over there looking at them.
#c 狗跟孩子同時都掉進河水裡了，鹿在那裡看著他們。。
#e Because the dog dropped into the water, it is carried by the kid.
#c 因為那個小狗掉進水裡，孩子把他扛起。

gloss: 變成-到-重疊-邊=改變狀態

free: #n itu batu lukis 又像石頭又像木頭的感覺

gloss: 可見.遠距-那裡=改變狀態
free: #e They walked across the river to the wood or stone, and they saw that are frogs over there.
#c 他們走到河邊的石頭還木頭的地方，他們看到原來是青蛙在那裡。
#n sia < hangsia
#e Also two frogs took a rest there.
#c 也有兩隻青蛙一起在那邊休息。
#n pa < aupa
#e They were happy because they found the frog.
#c 他們就很開心的找到這個青蛙。
#e They played there, sang there, and then they finished.
#c 他們在那玩耍, 在那邊唱歌，他們結束了。

gloss: 主焦-狀態-集合=改變狀態

free: #e They got together, they found the frog.
#c 他們聚在一起了，他們找到這個青蛙了。
#n 前面應該就是 itu 的口誤
#e The frog family also got together around the water, the stone, or the tree holes.
#c 青蛙的一家人也聚集在水裡、在石頭或樹洞裡面。
#e Everyone is there together, and the kid finished looking for (the frog).
#c 大家都在那邊集中一起，那孩子結束了他的尋找。
#e The kid brought over his dog.
#c 那孩子也把狗帶走了。
#n das-un < adas-un
#e He brought the frog he had kept back to the home and put it into the bottle.
#c 他把他本來養的那隻青蛙帶回家，放回到瓶子裡。
